cot.content:

when did the movie varsity blues come out

Answer: "Varsity Blues" was released on January 15, 1999.

"Varsity Blues" was released on **January 15, 1999**. It is a comedy-drama-sports film directed by Brian Robbins, featuring a cast that includes James Van Der Beek and Jon Voight. The film follows a small-town 3A high school football team in the fictional town of West Canaan, Texas, dealing with the pressures of adolescence and their football-obsessed community. A sequel, "Varsity Blues 2," was released in **2011**.
